intro: Thouinia simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved thouinia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and other similar species. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
